sentence.Network_en: I wondered why he had gone through the elaborate charade.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不明白，他为什么要大费周章，装腔作势。

sentence.Network_en: Their whole marriage had been a charade—they had never loved each other.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的整个婚姻都是在做戏—他们从未相爱过。

sentence.Network_en: He wasn't really upset — his behaviour was just a charade.
sentence.Network_cn: 他并不是真正心绪烦乱——他的行为只是荒谬的伪装.

the truth is that designating new features as " experimental " and announcing them only on a blog is just a charade , a marketing gimmick .事实上，把新的特色产品指定为“试验版”并只在博客上宣布仅仅是一种伪装、一种行销伎俩。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: from French, from modern Provençal charrado 'conversation', from charra 'chatter', perhaps of imitative origin

entry.tran: 明显的做作;一眼看穿的伪装
entry.def: If you describe someone's actions as a charade, you mean that their actions are so obviously false that they do not convince anyone.

example.ex: I wondered why he had gone through the elaborate charade...
example.tran: 我不明白，他为什么要大费周章，装腔作势。

example.ex: The UN at the moment is still trying to maintain the charade of neutrality.
example.tran: 联合国眼下还在努力摆出一副中立的假面孔。

entry.def: Charades is a game for teams of players in which one team acts a word or phrase, syllable by syllable, until other players guess the whole word or phrase.

example.ex: She and her three brothers played charades.
example.tran: 她和3个兄弟玩看手势猜字谜。

means.word_mean: 1. a composition that imitates somebody's style in a humorous way
2. a word acted out in an episode of the game of charades

auth_sentence.content: It doesn't take Einstein to see thru this charade.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It doesn't take Einstein to see thru this charade.

auth_sentence.content: It's about time this unedifying charade ended.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's about time this unedifying charade ended.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's about time this unedifying charade ended.

auth_sentence.content: Let's first dispose of this "nuanced policy" charade.

sentences.en: He wasn’t really upset—his behaviour was just a charade.
sentences.cn: 他并不是真正心绪烦乱——他的行为只是荒谬的伪装。

sentences.en: She struggled to maintain the charade of not being afraid.
sentences.cn: 她竭力装出不害怕的样子。

sentences.en: I refused to go along with their pathetic charade.
sentences.cn: 我拒不跟他们摆出那副可悲的装模作样的姿态。
